org.jtrim.image.transform

Class TransformationStepInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.image.transform.TransformationStepInput

  • public final class TransformationStepInput
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines the input of an ImageTransformationStep. That is, this is an input for an image transformation step within a chain of image transformations.

    The input consists of both the output of the previous transformation step and the original source image.

    Thread safety

    Methods of this class are allowed to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    Methods of this class are synchronization transparent.
    See Also:
    ImageTransformationStep

    • Constructor Detail

      • TransformationStepInput

        public TransformationStepInput(ImageResult source,
                       int destinationWidth,
                       int destinationHeight,
                       TransformedImage inputImage)
        Creates a new TransformationStepInput with the specified properties.
        Parameters:
        source - the ImageResult to be returned by the getSource() method. That is, the original source image of the transformation. This argument is allowed to be null, if the source image is not (yet) available.
        destinationWidth - the width of the area to where the image is to be displayed after the last applied transformation. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
        destinationHeight - the height of the area to where the image is to be displayed after the last applied transformation. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
        inputImage - the output of the previous image transformation step. This is the same as the source image for the first transformation to be applied. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the inputImage argument is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the destinationWidth or the destinationHeight is less than zero

    • Method Detail

      • getInputImage

        public TransformedImage getInputImage()
        Returns the output of the previous transformation step which should usually server as the input of the transformation applied after it.

        Note the pointTransformer property of the returned TransformedImage is relative to the original source image.

        Returns:
        the output of the previous transformation step which should usually server as the input of the transformation applied after it. This method may never return null.

      • getSource

        public ImageResult getSource()
        Returns the original source image of the whole image transformation chain or null if the source image was not available.
        Returns:
        the original source image of the whole image transformation chain or null if the source image was not available

      • getDestinationWidth

        public int getDestinationWidth()
        Returns the width of the final destination area of the whole image transformation chain. For GUI components, this is the width of the component.

        Warning: This method may return zero, which is not accepted as a width of a BufferedImage.

        Returns:
        the width of the final destination area of the whole image transformation chain. This method may never return a value less than zero.

      • getDestinationHeight

        public int getDestinationHeight()
        Returns the height of the final destination area of the whole image transformation chain. For GUI components, this is the height of the component.

        Warning: This method may return zero, which is not accepted as a width of a BufferedImage.

        Returns:
        the height of the final destination area of the whole image transformation chain. This method may never return a value less than zero.
